page.title: 03ECOLOGY.
page.content: {OWSTON WOODS & VARIOUS LAKES { ____________________________ Owston woods are young woods on the site of ancient forest mostly on clay, which was clear felled. Big Wood, to the west, is managed by the Forestry Commission who permit access to the central rides. The rides, used regularly by the Cottesmore Hunt, easily become water_logged which encourages the growth of marsh plants. The flora is very rich including four species of orchid, herb paris, helleborine, bluebell and primrose, while the fauna includes muntjac deer, dormouse, badger and fox. Birds include the nightingale, great spotted woodpecker and summer migrants who breed. Knossington lakes are a fishing amenity visited by geese and ducks in winter.
